- ELAINE: Jerry's ex, smart, assertive, works in publishing, most reasonable of the group
- KRAMER: Jerry's eccentric neighbor, bizarre ideas, oddly confident, distinctive cadence

[JERRY] Most men like working on things. Tools, objects, fixing things. This is what men enjoy doing. Have you ever noticed a guys out in his driveway working on something with tools, how all the other men in the neighborhood are magnetically drawn to this activity. They just come wandering out of the house like zombies. Men, its true, men hear a drill, its like a dog whistle. Just... you know, they go running up to that living room curtain, Honey, I think Jims working on something over there. So they run over to the guy. Now they dont actually help the guy. No, they just want to hang around the area where work is being done. Thats what men want to do. We want to watch the guy, we want to talk to him, we want to ask him dumb questions. You know, What are you using, a Phillips-head? You know, we feel involved. Thats why when they have construction sites, they have to have those wood panel fences around it, thats just to keep the men out. They cut those little holes for us so we can see what the hell is going on. But if they dont cut those holes, we are climbing those fences. Right over there. What are you using the steel girders down there? Yeah, thatll hold.
[GEORGE] I had to say something. I had to say something. Everything was going so well. I had to say something.
[JERRY] I dont think you did anything wrong.
[GEORGE] I told her I liked her. Why? Why did I tell her I like her? I have this sick compulsion to tell women how I feel. I like you I dont tell you.
[JERRY] We can only thank God for that.

[ELAINE] Look. You know I have this file here in my bag. Its a little too big to take the subway with me so I left it on my desk here at work.
[JERRY] How did you manage to do this? It was just three blocks away from your desk.
[GEORGE] Uh...
[JERRY] Im not giving it back to you until Im sure youre not going to start telling me how to live your life again. When do I get my file back?

[JERRY] Why? Whats so bad about this woman?
[GEORGE] Well, for starters, shes trying to get into my apartment complex. Whats she gonna do? Try to pick the lock?
[JERRY] Well, whats stopping you from locking it?
[GEORGE] All these things are starting to become familiar to me, that locking thing is very easy now.
[JERRY] Why dont you just give her a kick in the butt?
[GEORGE] What makes you think she has any strength? She is only 5 feet six inches. Youve seen her, you see how frail she is.
[KRAMER] Hey, where are you guys off to?
[GEORGE] Well we have an appointment with a guy at the construction site.
[KRAMER] Aha! Thats where Jerry took me last week and left me there.
[ELAINE] Oh, hi Kramer.
[KRAMER] Hi Elaine. Elaine please show this man the door.
[ELAINE] Oh no no, I dont think so.

[GEORGE] You think she likes me?
[JERRY] I dont know. What if shes just humoring you?
[GEORGE] Ill be able to tell. She always tells me how she feels.
[JERRY] Oh, yeah.
[ELAINE] Jerry.
[JERRY] Hey.
[ELAINE] Hey, this is Max Blumenfelds girlfriend.
[MATT] Hi.
[JERRY] How you doin?
[MATT] Thats my job. Elaine, we need to talk about this project weve got going on with Donna Borley at Lifetime TV and we really need to finalize the information so we can go with this draft by the end of the week. We are going to need a solid script for the pilot episode of a new series and were expecting it on Friday at 12 o clock. This script has got to be a hit, Elaine. Lets get together tomorrow night, Im gonna pick you up at 7 o clock, and well get the draft done before dinner.
[GEORGE] Did I hear that? Ill be there.
[ELAINE] Why dont you come up?
[MATT] Im not sure about that. Uh huh, I think Id rather work from my office..

This is a history of selfishness, self-absorption, immaturity, and greed.
